Translated by Tripiá¹­aka Master Xuanzang on Imperial Order
Chapter 15, Section 6: Distinguishing the Great Vehicle
SubhÅ«ti, you should know!
Because the earth element has no existence and cannot be apprehended, one who rides the Great Vehicle cannot be apprehended either.
Why is it so?
Because it is ultimately pure.
Because the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements have no existence and cannot be apprehended, one who rides the Great Vehicle cannot be apprehended either.
Why is it so?
Because it is ultimately pure.
SubhÅ«ti, you should know!
Because the noble truth of suffering has no existence and cannot be apprehended, one who rides the Great Vehicle cannot be apprehended either.
Why is it so?
Because it is ultimately pure.

Because the noble truths of the accumulation of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the path leading to the cessation of suffering have no existence and cannot be apprehended, one who rides the Great Vehicle cannot be apprehended either.
Why is it so?
Because it is ultimately pure.
SubhÅ«ti, you should know!
Because ignorance is non-existent and cannot be apprehended, one who rides the Great Vehicle cannot be apprehended either.
Why is it so?
Because it is ultimately pure.

In the same way, because formations, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress are non-existent and cannot be apprehended, one who rides the Great Vehicle cannot be apprehended either.
Why is it so?
Because it is ultimately pure.
SubhÅ«ti, you should know!
Because magical creations are non-existent and cannot be apprehended, one who rides the Great Vehicle cannot be apprehended either.
Why is it so?
Because it is ultimately pure.

In the same way, because dreams, reflections, echoes, shadows, space-flowers, mirages, cities of gandharvas, and magical creations are non-existent and cannot be apprehended, one who rides the Great Vehicle cannot be apprehended either.
Why is it so?
Because it is ultimately pure.
SubhÅ«ti, you should know!
Because inner emptiness is non-existent and cannot be attained, one who rides the Great Vehicle cannot be attained either.
Why is it so?
Because it is ultimately pure.

In the same way, because external emptiness, internal and external emptiness, emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, emptiness of conditioned phenomena, emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, emptiness of the ultimate, emptiness of the beginningless and endless, emptiness of dispersion, emptiness of inherent existence, emptiness of intrinsic nature, emptiness of common characteristics, emptiness of all phenomena, emptiness of non-apprehension, emptiness of nature, emptiness of intrinsic nature, and emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence are non-existent and cannot be attained, one who rides the Great Vehicle cannot be attained either.
Why is it so?
Because it is ultimately pure.
SubhÅ«ti, you should know!
Because the perfection of generosity is non-existent and cannot be attained, one who rides the Great Vehicle cannot be attained either.
Why is it so?
Because it is ultimately pure.

In this way, the perfection of morality, patience, diligence, concentration, and wisdom are non-existent and cannot be attained, and therefore one who rides the Great Vehicle can also not be attained.
Why is it so?
Because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti, you should know!
The four meditations are non-existent and cannot be attained, and therefore one who rides the Great Vehicle can also not be attained.
Why is it so?
Because of ultimate purity.
In this way, the four immeasurable [minds] and the four formless concentrations are non-existent and cannot be attained, and therefore one who rides the Great Vehicle can also not be attained.
Why is it so?
Because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti, you should know!
The four establishments of mindfulness are non-existent and cannot be attained, and therefore one who rides the Great Vehicle can also not be attained.
Why is it so?
Because of ultimate purity.

In this way, the four right efforts, four bases of supernatural power, five faculties, five powers, seven factors of awakening, and eightfold noble path are non-existent and cannot be attained, and therefore one who rides the Great Vehicle can also not be attained.
Why is it so?
Because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti, you should know!
The emptiness liberation gate is non-existent and cannot be attained, and therefore one who rides the Great Vehicle can also not be attained.
Why is it so?
Because of ultimate purity.
In this way, the signless and wishless liberation gates are non-existent and cannot be attained, and therefore one who rides the Great Vehicle can also not be attained.
Why is it so?
Because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti, you should know!
The five eyes are non-existent and cannot be attained, and therefore one who rides the Great Vehicle can also not be attained.
Why is it so?
Because of ultimate purity.
In this way, the six supernatural powers are non-existent and cannot be attained, and therefore one who rides the Great Vehicle can also not be attained.
Why is it so?
Because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti, you should know!
Because the ten powers of the Buddha are non-existent and cannot be attained, one who rides the Great Vehicle can also not be attained.
Why is it so?
Because of ultimate purity.

In this way, the four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great abandonment, the eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha, omniscience, the cognition of the pattern of the path, and the cognition of all aspects are non-existent and cannot be attained, and one who rides the Great Vehicle can also not be attained.
Why is it so?
Because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti, you should know!
Because the stream-enterer's rebirth in evil destinies is non-existent and cannot be attained, one who rides the Great Vehicle can also not be attained.
Why is it so?
Because of ultimate purity.ğŸ”½Here is the corrected and aligned text:

In the same way, the stream-enterer's frequent rebirth, the once-returner's rebirth in the desire realm, the great being's self-beneficial rebirth, the arhat, pratyekabuddha, and samyak-saá¹ƒbuddha's subsequent rebirth are non-existent and cannot be apprehended, and therefore the one who rides the Great Vehicle cannot be apprehended either.
Why is it so?
Because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti, you should know!
Because the approach to the fruit of stream-entry and the fruit of stream-entry are non-existent and cannot be apprehended, the one who rides the Great Vehicle cannot be apprehended either.
Why is it so?
Because of ultimate purity.

In the same way, the approach to the fruit of once-returning and the fruit of once-returning, the approach to the fruit of non-returning and the fruit of non-returning, the approach to arhatship and the fruit of arhatship, the approach to the state of a pratyekabuddha and the fruit of a pratyekabuddha, the bodhisattva, and the TathÄgata are non-existent and cannot be apprehended, and therefore the one who rides the Great Vehicle cannot be apprehended either.
Why is it so?
Because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti, you should know!
Because names, conceptual thoughts, designations, and expressions are non-existent and cannot be apprehended, one who rides the Great Vehicle also cannot be apprehended.
Why is it so?
Because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti, you should know!

Because non-arising, non-cessation, non-defilement, non-purification, signlessness, and the unconditioned are non-existent and cannot be apprehended, one who rides the Great Vehicle also cannot be apprehended.
Why is it so?
Because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti, you should know!
Because the past, present, and future are non-existent and cannot be apprehended, one who rides the Great Vehicle also cannot be apprehended.
Why is it so?
Because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti, you should know!
Because coming and going are non-existent and cannot be apprehended, one who rides the Great Vehicle also cannot be apprehended.
Why is it so?
Because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti, you should know!
Because going, staying, non-existence, and non-attainability are all non-apprehensible, one who rides the Great Vehicle is also non-apprehensible.
Why is it so?
Because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti, you should know!
Because non-arising, non-existence, and non-attainability are all non-apprehensible, one who rides the Great Vehicle is also non-apprehensible.
Why is it so?
Because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti, you should know!
Because increase and decrease, non-existence, and non-attainability are all non-apprehensible, one who rides the Great Vehicle is also non-apprehensible.
Why is it so?
Because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti, you should know!
Because the ground of joy, non-existence, and non-attainability are all non-apprehensible, one who rides the Great Vehicle is also non-apprehensible.
Why is it so?
Because of ultimate purity.

Thus, the ground of stainlessness, the ground of luminous radiance, the ground of flaming wisdom, the ground of utmost difficulty to conquer, the ground of manifest wisdom, the ground of far-reaching, the ground of immovability, the ground of excellent wisdom, and the ground of Dharma clouds are non-existent and cannot be attained, and therefore one who rides the Great Vehicle cannot be attained either.
Why is it so?
Because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti, you should know!
The ground of pure observation is non-existent and cannot be attained, and therefore one who rides the Great Vehicle cannot be attained either.
Why is it so?
Because of ultimate purity.

Thus, the ground of lineage, the eighth ground, the ground of complete seeing, the ground of thinness, the ground of separation from desires, the ground of accomplishment, the ground of pratyekabuddhas, the ground of bodhisattvas, and the ground of tathÄgatas are non-existent and cannot be attained, and therefore one who rides the Great Vehicle cannot be attained either.
Why is it so?
Because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti, you should know!
Because sentient beings to be matured do not exist and cannot be found, those riding the Great Vehicle also cannot be found.
Why is it so?
Because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti, you should know!
Because a buddha land to be purified does not exist and cannot be found, those riding the Great Vehicle also cannot be found.
Why is it so?
Because of ultimate purity.
At that time, SubhÅ«ti addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One!
Because of the non-findability of what dharmas is it said that we are unfindable?
The Buddha said:
SubhÅ«ti!
Because the nature of self is unfindable, it is said that self is unfindable;
up to because the nature of the seer is unfindable, it is said that the seer is unfindable.
Why is it so?
Because the nature of self up to the nature of the seer is not to be found in the past, is not to be found in the future, and is not to be found in the present, because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti!
Because the nature of suchness cannot be attained, suchness is said to be unattainable;
up to because the nature of the ultimate truth cannot be attained, the ultimate truth is said to be unattainable.
Why is this?
Because the nature of suchness up to the ultimate truth cannot be attained in the past, cannot be attained in the future, and cannot be attained in the present, it is ultimately pure.
SubhÅ«ti!
Because the nature of form cannot be attained, form is said to be unattainable;
up to because the nature of consciousness cannot be attained, consciousness is said to be unattainable.
Why is this?
Because the nature of form up to the nature of consciousness cannot be attained in the past, cannot be attained in the future, and cannot be attained in the present, it is ultimately pure.
SubhÅ«ti!
Because the nature of the eye sense base cannot be attained, the eye sense base is said to be unattainable;
up to because the nature of the mind sense base cannot be attained, the mind sense base is said to be unattainable.
Why is this?
The nature of the eye-base up to the nature of the mind-base, cannot be attained in the past, cannot be attained in the future, and cannot be attained in the present, because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti!
Because the nature of the form-base cannot be attained, the form-base is said to be unobtainable;
up to because the nature of the dharma-base cannot be attained, the dharma-base is said to be unobtainable.
Why is it so?
The nature of the form-base up to the nature of the dharma-base, cannot be attained in the past, cannot be attained in the future, and cannot be attained in the present, because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti!
Because the nature of the eye-element cannot be attained, the eye-element is said to be unobtainable;
up to because the nature of the feelings that arise from the condition of eye-contact cannot be attained, the feelings that arise from the condition of eye-contact are said to be unobtainable.
Why is it so?

The nature of the eye-element up to the nature of the feelings that arise from the condition of eye-contact, cannot be attained in the past, cannot be attained in the future, and cannot be attained in the present, because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti!
Because the nature of the ear-element is unobtainable, the ear-element is said to be unobtainable;
up to because the nature of the feelings that arise from the condition of ear-contact is unobtainable, the feelings that arise from the condition of ear-contact are said to be unobtainable.
Why is it so?

The nature of the ear-element, up to the nature of the feelings that arise from the condition of ear-contact, is not obtainable in the past, not obtainable in the future, and not obtainable in the present, because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti!
Because the nature of the nose-element is unobtainable, the nose-element is said to be unobtainable;
up to because the nature of the feelings that arise from the condition of nose-contact is unobtainable, the feelings that arise from the condition of nose-contact are said to be unobtainable.
Why is it so?

The nature of the nose-element, up to the nature of the feelings that arise from the condition of nose-contact, is not obtainable in the past, not obtainable in the future, and not obtainable in the present, because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti!
Because the nature of the tongue element is unobtainable, the tongue element is said to be unobtainable;
up to because the nature of the feelings produced from the condition of tongue contact is unobtainable, the feelings produced from the condition of tongue contact are said to be unobtainable.
Why is it so?

The nature of the tongue element, up to the nature of the feelings produced from the condition of tongue contact, is not obtainable in the past, not obtainable in the future, and not obtainable in the present, because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti!
Because the nature of the body element is unobtainable, the body element is said to be unobtainable;
up to because the nature of the feelings produced from the condition of body contact is unobtainable, the feelings produced from the condition of body contact are said to be unobtainable.
Why is it so?

The nature of the body element, up to the nature of the feelings produced from the condition of body contact, is not obtainable in the past, not obtainable in the future, and not obtainable in the present, because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti!
Because the nature of the mind element is unobtainable, the mind element is said to be unobtainable;
up to the nature of the mental contact as a condition and the feelings produced cannot be found, therefore the mental contact as a condition and the feelings produced cannot be found.
Why is it so?
The nature of the mind realm up to the nature of the mental contact as a condition and the feelings produced cannot be found, whether in the past, future, or present, because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti!
The nature of the earth element cannot be found, therefore the earth element cannot be found;
up to the nature of the consciousness element cannot be found, therefore the consciousness element cannot be found.
Why is it so?
The nature of the earth element up to the nature of the consciousness element cannot be found, whether in the past, future, or present, because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti!
The nature of the noble truth of suffering cannot be found, therefore the noble truth of suffering cannot be found;
up to the nature of the noble truth of the path cannot be found, therefore the noble truth of the path cannot be found.
Why is it so?

The nature of the noble truth of suffering, up to the nature of the noble truth of the path, cannot be attained in the past, cannot be attained in the future, and cannot be attained in the present, because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti!
Because the nature of ignorance cannot be attained, ignorance is said to be unattainable;

up to because the nature of old age, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, depression, and anguish cannot be attained, old age, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, depression, and anguish are said to be unattainable.
Why is it so?

The nature of ignorance, up to the nature of old age, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, depression, and anguish, cannot be attained in the past, cannot be attained in the future, and cannot be attained in the present, because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti!
Because the nature of an illusory person cannot be attained, an illusory person is said to be unattainable;
up to because the nature of a transformed person cannot be attained, a transformed person is said to be unattainable.
Why is it so?

The nature of an illusory person, up to the nature of a transformed person, cannot be attained in the past, cannot be attained in the future, and cannot be attained in the present, because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti!
Because the nature of inner emptiness cannot be attained, inner emptiness is said to be unattainable;
up to because the nature of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence cannot be attained, the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence is said to be unattainable.
Why is this?

The nature of inner emptiness, up to the nature of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence, cannot be attained in the past, cannot be attained in the future, and cannot be attained in the present, because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti!
Because the nature of the perfection of giving cannot be attained, the perfection of giving is said to be unattainable;
up to because the nature of the perfection of wisdom cannot be attained, the perfection of wisdom is said to be unattainable.
Why is this?

The nature of the perfection of giving, up to the nature of the perfection of wisdom, cannot be attained in the past, cannot be attained in the future, and cannot be attained in the present, because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti!
The nature of the four concentrations is unobtainable, therefore the four concentrations are said to be unobtainable;
up to the nature of the four formless concentrations is unobtainable, therefore the four formless concentrations are said to be unobtainable.
Why is it so?

The nature of the four concentrations, up to the nature of the four formless concentrations, is not obtainable in the past, not obtainable in the future, and not obtainable in the present, because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti!
The nature of the four establishments of mindfulness is unobtainable, therefore the four establishments of mindfulness are said to be unobtainable;
up to the nature of the eightfold noble path is unobtainable, therefore the eightfold noble path is said to be unobtainable.
Why is it so?

The nature of the four establishments of mindfulness, up to the nature of the eightfold noble path, is not obtainable in the past, not obtainable in the future, and not obtainable in the present, because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti!
The nature of the emptiness liberation gate is unobtainable, therefore the emptiness liberation gate is said to be unobtainable;
up to the nature of the gate of liberation of wishlessness cannot be attained, therefore the gate of liberation of wishlessness is said to be unattainable.
Why is it so?

The nature of the gate of liberation of emptiness, up to the nature of the gate of liberation of wishlessness, cannot be attained in the past, cannot be attained in the future, and cannot be attained in the present, because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti!
The nature of the five eyes cannot be attained, therefore the five eyes are said to be unattainable;
the nature of the six supernormal knowledges cannot be attained, therefore the six supernormal knowledges are said to be unattainable.
Why is it so?

The nature of the five eyes and the nature of the six supernormal knowledges cannot be attained in the past, cannot be attained in the future, and cannot be attained in the present, because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti!
The nature of the ten powers of a Buddha cannot be attained, therefore the ten powers of a Buddha are said to be unattainable;
up to the nature of omniscience cannot be attained, therefore omniscience is said to be unattainable.
Why is it so?

The nature of the ten powers of the Buddha, up to the nature of omniscience, cannot be attained in the past, cannot be attained in the future, and cannot be attained in the present, because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti!
Because the nature of rebirth in evil destinies of a stream-enterer cannot be attained, it is said that rebirth in evil destinies of a stream-enterer cannot be attained;
up to because the nature of rebirth in a later existence of a tathÄgata cannot be attained, it is said that a tathÄgata cannot be attained.
Why is it so?

Because the nature of rebirth in evil destinies of a stream-enterer, up to the nature of rebirth in a later existence of a tathÄgata, cannot be attained in the past, cannot be attained in the future, and cannot be attained in the present, because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti!

Because the nature of the approacher to the fruit of stream-entry and the fruit of stream-entry cannot be attained, it is said that the approacher to the fruit of stream-entry and the fruit of stream-entry cannot be attained;
up to because the nature of a tathÄgata cannot be attained, it is said that a tathÄgata cannot be attained.
Why is it so?

The nature of the stream-enterer, the nature of the fruit of stream-entry, up to the nature of the TathÄgata, cannot be attained in the past, cannot be attained in the future, and cannot be attained in the present, because of utter purity.
SubhÅ«ti!
The nature of names, conceptual thoughts, designations, and expressions cannot be attained, therefore it is said that names, conceptual thoughts, designations, and expressions cannot be attained.
Why is it so?

The nature of names, conceptual thoughts, designations, and expressions cannot be attained in the past, cannot be attained in the future, and cannot be attained in the present, because of utter purity.
SubhÅ«ti!

The nature of non-arising, non-ceasing, non-defilement, non-purification, signlessness, and non-conditioning cannot be attained, therefore it is said that non-arising, non-ceasing, non-defilement, non-purification, signlessness, and non-conditioning cannot be attained.
Why is it so?

The nature of non-arising, non-ceasing, non-defilement, non-purification, signlessness, and non-conditioning cannot be attained in the past, cannot be attained in the future, and cannot be attained in the present, because of utter purity.
SubhÅ«ti!
Because the nature of the beginning, middle, and end cannot be attained, it is said that the beginning, middle, and end cannot be attained.
Why is it so?
The nature of the beginning, middle, and end cannot be attained in the past, cannot be attained in the future, and cannot be attained in the present, because it is ultimately pure.
SubhÅ«ti!
Because the nature of coming and going cannot be attained, it is said that coming and going cannot be attained.
Why is it so?
The nature of coming and going cannot be attained in the past, cannot be attained in the future, and cannot be attained in the present, because it is ultimately pure.
SubhÅ«ti!
Because the nature of walking and staying cannot be attained, it is said that walking and staying cannot be attained.
Why is it so?
The nature of walking and staying cannot be attained in the past, cannot be attained in the future, and cannot be attained in the present, because it is ultimately pure.
SubhÅ«ti!
Because the nature of death and rebirth cannot be attained, it is said that death and rebirth cannot be attained.
Why is it so?
The nature of death and birth cannot be attained, whether in the past, the future, or the present, because it is ultimately pure.
SubhÅ«ti!
The nature of increase and decrease cannot be attained, therefore it is said that increase and decrease cannot be attained.
Why is it so?
The nature of increase and decrease cannot be attained, whether in the past, the future, or the present, because it is ultimately pure.
SubhÅ«ti!
The nature of the ground of joy cannot be attained, therefore it is said that the ground of joy cannot be attained;
up to the nature of the cloud of Dharma ground cannot be attained, therefore it is said that the cloud of Dharma ground cannot be attained.
Why is it so?
The nature of the ground of joy, up to the nature of the cloud of Dharma ground, cannot be attained, whether in the past, the future, or the present, because it is ultimately pure.
SubhÅ«ti!ğŸ”½The nature of the ground of contemplation of purity cannot be attained, therefore it is said that the ground of contemplation of purity cannot be attained;
up to the nature of the ground of the TathÄgata cannot be attained, therefore it is said that the ground of the TathÄgata cannot be attained.
Why is it so?

The nature of the stage of contemplation of purity up to the nature of the stage of TathÄgata is not obtainable in the past, not obtainable in the future, and not obtainable in the present, because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti!
The nature of bringing sentient beings to maturity is unobtainable, therefore bringing sentient beings to maturity is said to be unobtainable.
Why is it so?
The nature of bringing sentient beings to maturity is not obtainable in the past, not obtainable in the future, and not obtainable in the present, because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti!
The nature of purifying a buddha-land is unobtainable, therefore purifying a buddha-land is said to be unobtainable.
Why is it so?
The nature of purifying a buddha-land is not obtainable in the past, not obtainable in the future, and not obtainable in the present, because of ultimate purity.
Furthermore, SubhÅ«ti!
In the emptiness of internal phenomena, the nature of generosity, discipline, patience, diligence, concentration, and wisdom cannot be found, so generosity up to wisdom are said to be unobtainable.

Up to in the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities, the nature of generosity, discipline, patience, diligence, concentration, and wisdom cannot be found, so generosity up to wisdom are said to be unobtainable.
Why is this?

Because in this, the nature of generosity, discipline, patience, diligence, concentration, and wisdom, cannot be found as already attained, not yet attained, or presently attained, because of their ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti!

In the emptiness of internal phenomena, the nature of the four concentrations, four immeasurables, and four formless concentrations cannot be found, so the four concentrations, four immeasurables, and four formless concentrations are said to be unobtainable;

up to in the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence, the nature of the four concentrations, four immeasurables, and four formless concentrations cannot be apprehended, therefore the four concentrations, four immeasurables, and four formless concentrations are said to be unapprehendable.
Why is it so?

Herein, the nature of the four concentrations, four immeasurables, and four formless concentrations is not to be apprehended as already existent, not to be apprehended as yet to come, and not to be apprehended as present, because of ultimate purity.

SubhÅ«ti!ğŸ”½In internal emptiness, the nature of the four establishments of mindfulness, four right efforts, four bases of supernatural powers, five faculties, five powers, seven factors of enlightenment, and eightfold noble path cannot be apprehended, therefore the four establishments of mindfulness up to the eightfold noble path are said to be unapprehendable;

up to in the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence, the nature of the four establishments of mindfulness, four right efforts, four bases of supernatural powers, five faculties, five powers, seven factors of enlightenment, and eightfold noble path cannot be apprehended, therefore the four establishments of mindfulness up to the eightfold noble path are said to be unapprehendable.
Why is it so?

Herein, the nature of the four establishments of mindfulness, four right efforts, four bases of supernatural power, five faculties, five powers, seven factors of awakening, and eightfold noble path is not to be attained in the past, not to be attained in the future, and not to be attained in the present, because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti!

The nature of the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness doors to liberation is not to be attained in inner emptiness, therefore the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness doors to liberation are said to be not to be attained;

up to the nature of the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness doors to liberation is not to be attained in the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities, therefore the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness doors to liberation are said to be not to be attained.
Why is it so?

Herein, the nature of the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness doors to liberation is not to be attained in the past, not to be attained in the future, and not to be attained in the present, because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti!
In the emptiness of internal phenomena, the nature of the five eyes and six supernormal knowledges is unobtainable, so the five eyes and six supernormal knowledges are said to be unobtainable;

up to in the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence, the nature of the five eyes and six supernormal knowledges is unobtainable, so the five eyes and six supernormal knowledges are said to be unobtainable.
Why is this?

Because in this, the nature of the five eyes and six supernormal knowledges is not obtainable in the past, is not obtainable in the future, and is not obtainable in the present, because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti!

In the emptiness of internal phenomena, the nature of the ten powers of a buddha, the four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, the eighteen distinctive qualities of a buddha, omniscience, the cognition of the path, and the cognition of all aspects is unobtainable, so the ten powers of a buddha up to the cognition of all aspects are said to be unobtainable;

up to in the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence, the nature of the ten powers of the Buddha, the four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, the eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha, omniscience, the cognition of the path, and the cognition of all aspects cannot be apprehended, therefore the ten powers of the Buddha up to the cognition of all aspects are said to be unapprehendable.
Why is it so?

Herein, the nature of the ten powers of the Buddha, the four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, the eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha, omniscience, the cognition of the path, and the cognition of all aspects, cannot be apprehended as existent, cannot be apprehended as non-existent, and cannot be apprehended as present, because of ultimate purity.
SubhÅ«ti!

The venerable SubhÅ«ti addressed the Buddha, saying:
The World-Honored One speaks of the Great Vehicle. The Great Vehicle surpasses all the gods, humans, and asuras in the world, and is the most honored and wonderful.

This Great Vehicle is equal to space. It is like space, which can universally contain innumerable, immeasurable, and limitless sentient beings. The Great Vehicle is also like this, universally able to contain innumerable, immeasurable, and limitless sentient beings.
Just as space has no coming, no going, and no abiding that can be seen, so too is the Great Vehicle, with no coming, no going, and no abiding that can be seen.

Just as the past, future, and present cannot be apprehended in space, so too are the past, future, and present not apprehended in the Great Vehicle, because the three times are equal. This is called the Great Vehicle.

If the desire realm were true suchness, not false or inverted, not a provisional designation, but a truth, a reality, permanent, eternal, unchanging, and immutable, with an intrinsic nature, then this Mahayana would not be superior or wonderful, and would not surpass all the worlds of gods, humans, and asuras.
